content:
48. An alter was set up to the Unknown God in the Greek 
town of 
A. Athens  B. Thebes  C. Ephesus 
D. Macedonia E. Sparta 
49. ‘You have appealed to Caesar: To Caesar then you shall 
go. This statement was made to Paul by 
A. Agrippa B. Festus  
C. Claudius Lysias   D. Publius 
E. Felix 
50. The people of Malta thought that Paul must be a 
murderer because he 
A. was bitten by a poisonous snake 
B. told them about hell 
C. was being taken to Rome as a prisoner 
D. preached to them about the crucifixion of 
Jesus  
E. was going to answer charges before Caesar. 
 
  CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE 1986  
 
1. ‘This at last is bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh; 
she shall be called Woman because she was … 
A. The first woman 
B. The mother of all living 
C. The man’s partner 
D. Taken out of man. 
2. When God called Abram out of Haran, his first place of 
call in Canaan was 
A. Bethel B.  Negeb C.  Shechem D. Moreh. 
3. ‘This is none other than the house of God, and this is 
the gate of heaven’, was said by 
A. Abraham at Shechem B. Jacob at Bethe 
C. Moses at the burning bush D. Moses at Sinai. 
4. The Egyptians enslaved the Israelites and forced them 
to build 
A. store-cities B. bridges C. temples D. canals. 
5. The Passover was to remind the Israelites of 
A. God’s execution of judgment on the gods of 
Egypt 
B. God’s smiting of all the first born in Egypt 
C. The seven  days of eating  unleavened bread 
D. The eating of roasted lamb while standing. 
 
6. The consecration of the people of Israel took place at 
the foot of Mount 
A. Carmel B. Nebo C.  Sinai D. Gilboa 
7. What occasion is reflected in this statement? ‘It is not 
the sound of shouting for victory, or the sound of the 
cry of defeat, but the sound of singing that I hear.’ 
A. Celebrating the Exodus 
B. Rejoicing for the water from the rock 
C. Praising God after receiving the Ten 
Commandments 
D. The apostasy of Aaron and the  people. 
8. When Moses was instructed to view the Promised Land 
afar, he 
A. made arrangements to capture it 
B. summoned the elders and informed them about 
the land 
C. was struck dead immediately 
D. prayed for a successor to shepherd the people 
9. Who gave this advice? ‘Now therefore, fear the Lord 
and serve him in sincerity and faithfulness; put away 
the godswhich your fathers served beyond the River 
and in Egypt, and serve the Lord.’ 
A. Moses B. Joshua C. Aaron D. Caleb 
10. To whom was this addressed? 
‘Rule over us you and your son and your grandson also, 
for you have delivered us out of the hand of Midian. 
A. Deborah B. Samson C. Gideon D. Jephthah 
11. Who asked this question? 
‘Which is better for you that all seventy of the sons of 
Jerubbaal rule over you, or that one rule over you? 
A. Abimelech B. Ahimelech C. Jotham D. Elimelech 
12. At childhood, the word of the Lord came to Samuel 
because he 
A. was righteous 
B. had the qualities of a prophet 
C. was to announce the punishment for the house 
of Eli 
D. slept near the altar 
13. ‘Cursed be the man who takes food before evening 
before I am able to avenge myself on my enemies.’ This 
was said by Saul during the battle between Israel and 
the 
A. Ammonites B. Jebusites C. Amalekites 
D. Philistines 
14. Who was the man who, in an attempt to prevent a 
disaster, touched the Ark and died when David was 
returning it to Jerusalem? 
A. Obed-edom B. Abinadab C. Uzzah D. Ahio 
15. The suggestion made by prophet Nathan to Bathsheba 
to foil Adonijah’s attempt to usurp the throne of David 
was to 
A. have Adonijah banished 
B. remind David of his promise that Solomon would 
succeed him 
C. have Solomon secretly anointed by Zadok 
D. plead with Adonijah to abandon the attempt. 
16. It was wrong for King Solomon to have married foreign 
women because 
A. they would entice him to worship idols 
B. the women of Israel were more beautiful 
C. they were very jealous 
D. a King should not have too many children 
17. How many months were the Israelites on forced labour 
in Lebanon allowed to spend at home for every month 
at the labour camp? 
A. Two B.  Three C.  Four D. Five 
18. Which of the following Kings said ‘Behold your gods, 
of Israel, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt? 
A. Rehoboam B. Ahab C. Jeroboam D. Zedekiah
